availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: H. A. Huesman (Eminence, Kentucky, and Middletown, Kentucky, liquor merchant)

body.p: Eminence, Kentucky, and Middletown, Kentucky, liquor merchant. Native of Baden. Married to Morinda Huesman. Father of Mathias Huesman, Theodore Huesman, Amelia Huesman, Julia Huesman, Hinkelmina Huesman, Herman Huesman, Mary Huesman, and Walter Huesman. Owned liquor mercantile in Louisville from 1862 to 1865.

ab.bibl: U.S. IRS Tax Assessment Lists, 1862-1918, Ancestry, Kentucky, 1862, Collection District 3, Division 10, p. 23. U.S. IRS Tax Assessment Lists, 1862-1918, Ancestry, Kentucky, 1863, Collection District 3, Division 10, p. 12. U.S. IRS Tax Assessment Lists, 1862-1918, Ancestry, Kentucky, 1865, Collection District 3, Division 9, p. 23 Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 10, p. 19. KYR-0001-029-0580.
